mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Clarysville Hospital. Civil War Records of Samuel West, Physician
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Patient Record for Babbott, Charles
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: Flat Rock, Seneca Co., Ohio [Flat Rock, Seneca County, Ohio]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Patient Name: Babbott, Charles Patient Age: 20. Marital Status: Single. Diagnosis: Gun shot wound of glutial region. Bullet entering left glutial region 2 to 3 inches to the left of coccyx bone - Direction passing over this bone then inward and outwards and lodged near the hip joint. Location Wounded: In act[ion] at Winchester, Va. Date Wounded: 1864/07/20. Nature of Wound: Bullet. Result: Furlough 1864/10/15. Transferred to US Gen Hospital Columbus Ohio 1865/01/10.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Babbott, Charles

Gun shot wound of glutial region. Bullet entering left glutial region 2 to 3 inches to the left of coccyx bone - Direction passing over this bone then inward and outwards and lodged near the hip joint
